controller

Class TDController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.TDController

  • public class TDController
extends java.lang.Object
    The general controller used to interact with the game in its current state. Contains a Player reference that holds the state of current user that is playing the game. Also contains a reference to GameState which holds lists for all of the towers, enemies, projectiles as well as logic for changing all of the entities at each tick of the game.
    Author:
    Ethan Glasberg (glasberg@email.arizona.edu), Jarod Bristol (jarodkylebristol@email.arizona.edu), Alex Gonzalez (aegonzalez793@email.arizona.edu), Patrick Dearborn (pdearborn@email.arizona.edu)

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Calls the tick method in the game state to update the positions of all of the entities on the board.

      • isPlayerDead

        public boolean isPlayerDead()
        Figure out whether the player is dead based on their health. If it is less than or equal to 0, they are dead.
        Returns:
        true of the player is dead, false otherwise

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Figure out if the game is over based on which wave we are on.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over, false otherwise

      • canPurchaseTower

        public boolean canPurchaseTower(java.lang.String name)
        Determines if the player can purchase a tower specified by its name
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tower
        Returns:
        true if the tower can be purchased, false otherwise

      • canPlaceTower

        public boolean canPlaceTower(int x,
                             int y,
                             int height,
                             int width)
        Determine if the selected tower can be placed at a specified x or y position. A tower must be selected before this method is called. The x and y position passed into this function should correspond to the middle of where the tower should be placed.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate at the middle of where the tower should be placed
        y - the y coordinate at the middle of where the tower should be placed
        height - the height of the board that we are placing the tower on
        width - the width of the board that we are placing the tower on
        Returns:
        true if the selected tower can be placed at the specified position, false otherwise

      • checkBulletCollision

        public boolean checkBulletCollision(Projectile bullet)
        Check if a Projectile has collided with any enemies.
        Parameters:
        bullet - Projectile to be checked with a collision.
        Returns:
        True or false depending if a collision was made or not.

      • getCollision

        public boolean getCollision(Entity e1,
                            Entity e2)
        Determines if there is a collision between two entities.
        Parameters:
        e1 - the first Entity to check
        e2 - the second Entity to check
        Returns:
        true if the two entities are colliding, false otherwise

      • addTower

        public void addTower(int x,
                     int y)
        Adds the current selected tower to the tower list and subtracts the tower's cost from the player's money.
        Parameters:
        x - This is a x coordinate
        y - This is a y coordinate

      • sellTower

        public boolean sellTower(int x,
                         int y)
        Checks if the user clicked on a tower. If a tower was clicked on, then sell it back to the player and reference the selected tower.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of where the player clicked
        y - the y coordinate of where the player clicked
        Returns:
        True or false depending if a tower was sold back or not.

      • getTowerCost

        public int getTowerCost(java.lang.String towerName)
        Returns the cost of a tower object by its associated name.
        Parameters:
        towerName - the name of the tower object to get
        Returns:
        The cost of the specified tower object.

      • addGold

        public void addGold(int gold)
        Adds gold to the Player's money
        Parameters:
        gold - the amount of money to add to the Player

      • getTowerByName

        private Tower getTowerByName(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a specific tower by name by doing a lookup in the TowerType enum and then getting and instance of the class through reflection. If a tower of the specified name is not found, the default tower is returned instead.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the tower to get
        Returns:
        A Tower object

      • getTowerImageMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,javafx.scene.image.Image> getTowerImageMap()
        Gets a map of all of the tower names to its associated image.
        Returns:
        A Map of String to Image with the key being the tower's name and the value being the tower's Image

      • getTowerNames

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getTowerNames()
        Returns a set of all of the possible tower names that can be added to the board.
        Returns:
        A Set containing the names of all of the towers available

      • addPathTile

        public void addPathTile(int x,
                        int y,
                        int width,
                        int height)
        Adds a "path tile" to the game state. Used for keeping track of which portions of the map are going to be used as the path for enemies to take
        Parameters:
        x - top left x coordinate of the tile
        y - top left y coordinate of the tile
        width - width of the tile in pixels
        height - height of the tile in pixels

      • getIsPlaying

        public boolean getIsPlaying()
        Gets whether or not the current wave is running or paused.
        Returns:
        playing This is a boolean that determines if current wave is playing.

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Creates a new AnimationTimer that runs while the games is in progress. Calls the tick method to update all of the objects on the screen every 40 milliseconds.

      • isNewRound

        public boolean isNewRound()
        Return the state of the round.
        Returns:
        true if the round ended, false if a round is still running.

      • nextWave

        public void nextWave()
        Gets the next wave of enemies, adds them to the game state and then starts the wave.
